unitCommand.name: Enable Accident Reconstruction Logging
unitCommand.help: Enable Accident Reconstruction Logging
unitCommand.notes: Turning ON this parameter will enable the accident reconstruction functionality of the MHub918.

unitCommand.name: Verify Ignition On
unitCommand.help: Only write accident reconstruction records if ignition is ON
unitCommand.notes: When accident reconstruction is enabled on the MHub, certain information is recorded every second that is to be used in the event of an accident to reconstruct the accident. Limitations can be placed on the recording of the accident data. Enabling this parameter will result in the accident data only being recorded when ignition is ON.

unitCommand.name: Verify Speed
unitCommand.help: Set this bit to verify that the selected speed of the vehicle is greater than required minimum
unitCommand.notes: Accident reconstruction data is recorded every second. Limitations can be placed on the recording of data to ensure that only relevant data is recorded. The MHub does not really need to record data when the vehicle is standing still. If this value is enabled, then the accident recording will only occur if the speed of the vehicle is greater than the speed specified in the "Minimum Required Speed" parameter under the Accident Reconstruction section.

unitCommand.name: Minimum Required Speed
unitCommand.help: Minimum Speed at which any accident reconstruction records will be written if this option is selected
unitCommand.notes: If parameter Verify Speed is enabled, the MHub is instructed to only record accident data if the speed if the vehicle is greater than the value specified in this parameter.

unitCommand.name: Accident Reconstruction Log
unitCommand.help: Use Flash 1 or Data Flash Card for the Accident Reconstruction Log
unitCommand.notes: The MHub918 can record accident data to either the internal memory, or to the flash memory card inserted into the memory card slot on the underside of the MHub918 PCB. The ability to write the accident data into the memory card implies that a bigger memory card will be able to hold more accident information. The values are as follows: 0 = Internal Memory 1 = Expanded Memory

unitCommand.name: Enable Battery Charger
unitCommand.help: Enable Battery Charger
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
0 - Battery Charger is managed by Charging Hardware e.g. always on 1 - Battery Charger only active during ignition on 2 - Battery Charger Disabled n - Battery Charger is managed by Charging Hardware e.g. always on

unitCommand.name: SMS DebounceTimer
unitCommand.help: Debounce Timer for SMS Communications Medium
unitCommand.notes:
The MHub can send data to Mprofiler over various communications mediums, such as SMS, GPRS, Satellite etc. There can be a total of 8 different communications mediums, some of which are still to be implemented.The communications Mediums implemented to date are: 1. SMS 2. GPRS 3. Roaming SMS 4. Roaming GPRS 5. Satellite The MHub is configured to use the communications mediums in order of priority. Thus an option will be to have GPRS as the highest priority, followed by SMS, and then perhaps Roaming GPRS. This is done in patameter "User CM Preference Order". What this means is that the MHub will always try to be in a position where it can send data over GPRS, and will send events that have been configured to be sent over GPRS. If however for some reason GPRS is not available, the MHub will fall back to the second priority medium which in this case will be SMS. Now events that have been configured to be sent over SMS will be sent.
The value of this parameter indicates the amount of time that the particular Communications Medium will be held after the MHub has deemed it to be unavailable, before dropping to the next available Communications Medium. This is to prevent messages being sent over SMS if GPRS becomes available for only a short while.
For example if the GPRS Debounce Timer was set to 120 seconds (times are in seconds for the debounce timers) and the GPRS network became unreachable then events that are marked for GPRS transmission will be extracted from the flash and queued for 120 seconds after GPRS has become unavailable.
Once 120 seconds has passed with no GPRS coverage the next available CM (SMS for example) determined from the "User CM Preference Order" will take over and the current queue will be destroyed and a new queue set up with events that must be sent over that particular CM. In this example, SMS.

unitCommand.name: User CM Preference Order
unitCommand.help: Preference order of communications mediums usage as selected by user
unitCommand.notes:
As described in SMS DebounceTimer, the MHub is configured with a priority oder of the required communications mediums. This parameter is where this assignment is done. This is a string of 8 bytes represented as hexadecimal values where the highest priority medium is specified first then the second one, etc.
Each medium has a unique number they are: - 00: SMS - 01: GPRS - 02: Roaming SMS - 03: Roaming GPRS - 04: Iridium Satellite - 64: Not Used
As an example: Say we want to specify GPRS then SMS in that order and nothing else you would set it to: 0100646464646464
- or - Say you want to use only GPRS, then set it to 0164646464646464
default: 0100030264646464

unitCommand.name: Comm. Policy 0 - Enable SMS
unitCommand.help: Enable SMS for Communications Medium Policy 0
unitCommand.notes:
As described previously, the MHub makes use of various communications mediums, such as SMS, GPRS, roaming SMS etc. And the MHub is configured with a order of priority of these communications mediums. Thus if GPRS is the highest priority, the MHub will always attempt to be in a position where it can send messages over GPRS.
The Communications Medium Policies (of which there are 8) are used to specify for individual events over what communicatiosn mediums the event may be transmitted.

unitCommand.name: CM Immediate SMS Fallback
unitCommand.help: CM Immediate SMS Fallback during VOICE/DATA call
unitCommand.notes: CM Immediate SMS Fallback during VOICE/DATA call will invalidate the GPRS medium and force events to be sent using SMS.

unitCommand.name: Enable All Debug
unitCommand.help: Switch all debug statements ON or OFF
unitCommand.notes: The value represents the debug time-out in minutes. Setting the value to 255 is a special case causing the debugs to be permanently active.

unitCommand.name: Enable Info Debug Messages
unitCommand.help: Enable Info Debug Messages
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Info Debug messages

unitCommand.name: Enable Warning Debug Messages
unitCommand.help: Enable Warning Debug Messages
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Warning Debug messages

unitCommand.name: Enable Error Debug Messages
unitCommand.help: Enable Error Debug Messages
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Error Debug messages

unitCommand.name: Enable Box Leds
unitCommand.help: Enable Box Leds
unitCommand.notes: The MHub has 3 LED's that are used to indicate various operational states of teh MHub, this is particularly usefull during the installation and fault diagnosis processes to determine of the MHub is operating correctly. However from a vehicle being stolen scenario, flashing LED's will draw attention to the MHub. It is thus possible to turn OFF the LED's completely by disabling this parameter.

unitCommand.name: Enable USB Debug
unitCommand.help: Enables use of the USB connector for Debug functionality.
unitCommand.notes: Set this value to 1 to enable debug information to be streamed out of the USB port, else set it to 0 to disable it

unitCommand.name: Trace Level
unitCommand.help: This is the level of trace information that would be sent to the debug port
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Module Debug Mask
unitCommand.help: Enable debug statements for a specific Module
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Pre Trip Validity
unitCommand.help: Driver key time out before trip start
unitCommand.notes: This is relevant when a driver key is used, and linked to the immobilizer function of the MHub. When the driver key is inserted, and the MHub authenticates it, it will turn the relevant output on for a certain time, whicle waiting for the ignition to be turned ON. If ignition is not turned on within the time indicated by this parameter, the output will be turned OFF, and the driver will then need to reinsert the key again before the vehcile can be driven. The value is in seconds and the default is 30 seconds

unitCommand.name: Post Trip Validity
unitCommand.help: Driver key time out after trip end
unitCommand.notes: This is relevant when a driver key is used, and linked to the immobilizer function of the MHub. A driver inserts a valid key, the output goes ON, the driver starts the vehicle and drives off. When the driver turns the ignition OFF, the output can remain on for a certain time, thus allowing the driver to start the vehicle again without having to reinsert the key. (this is particularly usefull if a driver is struggling to strat a vehicle). This parameter specified the length of time is seconds that the output will remain ON after the driver has turned Ignition OFF. The default value is 30 seconds.

unitCommand.name: Fleet Code
unitCommand.help: Fleet code assigned to the MHub
unitCommand.notes: The fleet code is a value between 0 and 65535 that is used for driver key comparison. The driver key is also programmed with a fleet code, and the fleet code and the driver key must match the fleet code on the MHub (this Value) before the driver key can be authenticated.

unitCommand.name: Vehicle Class
unitCommand.help: Vehicle class the MHub is installed into
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: Customer Code
unitCommand.help: This allows a key to be linked to a specific customer.
unitCommand.notes: If this feature is enabled, only keys containing the same code as written to this parameter will allow access to the vehicle.

unitCommand.name: Vehicle Disablement Delay
unitCommand.help: Vehicle Disablement Delay
unitCommand.notes: Vehicle Disablement Delay from request to vehicle disabled in seconds.

unitCommand.name: CS905 Driver Key Used
unitCommand.help: CS905 Driver Key Used via SoftUart
unitCommand.notes: In order to maintain compatibility with fleets that use existing CS905 type driver keys, the MHub has the ability to read these older type of keys. If these old keys are to be used with the MHub, this parameter must be enabled.

unitCommand.name: CS905 Master Key Used
unitCommand.help: CS905 Master Key 0: Not Used 1: Used
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: Output4 used for Immobilisation
unitCommand.help: Driver Key Immobilisation
unitCommand.notes: If the driver key is intended to control the immobilizer connection to the vehicle, then this parameter must be set to 1.

unitCommand.name: Enable Driver Key
unitCommand.help: Driver Key Used
unitCommand.notes: If the driver key is used, then this parameter must be set to 1

unitCommand.name: Verify Fleet Code
unitCommand.help: Driver Fleet Used
unitCommand.notes: The driver key is programmed with a Driver Fleet value, and the MHub is also programmed with a Driver Fleet value. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to compare the Driver Fleet on the driver key to the Driver Fleet value programmed on the MHub in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key. If this parameter is set to 1, then the two driver fleet values need to match before the MHub will authenticate the driver key.

unitCommand.name: Verify Driver Class
unitCommand.help: Driver Class Used
unitCommand.notes: The driver key is programmed with a class value, and the MHub is also programmed with a class value. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to use the class values in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key.

unitCommand.name: Verify Driver ID
unitCommand.help: Custom Driver ID Used
unitCommand.notes: The driver key is programmed with a Driver ID value, and the MHub is also programmed with a list of DRiver ID values. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to compare the Driver ID on the driver key to any of the Driver ID values programmed on the MHub in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key. This means that for the driver key to authenticate, the specific driver ID programmed onto that driver key must have been programmed into the MHub already.

unitCommand.name: Verify Customer Code
unitCommand.help: Customer ID Used
unitCommand.notes: The driver key is programmed with a Customer Code, and the MHub is also programmed with a Customer Code. This parameter specifies whether the MHub is to compare the Customer Code on the driver key to the Customer Code programmed on the MHub in determinng whether to authenticate a driver key. If this parameter is enabled, then the two Customer Code values need to match before the MHub will authenticate the driver key.

unitCommand.name: Driver ID 1
unitCommand.help: Customer Driver ID 1
unitCommand.notes: When the driver key authentication is set to compare the driver ID on the driver key to one of the pre programmed Driver ID codes on the MHub, this parameter is one of the driver id's that will be compared. One of the 8 Customer Driver ID fields will have to match that on the driver key before the MHub will authenticate the driver key.

unitCommand.name: Periodic Position
unitCommand.help: Periodic Position Event Configuration
unitCommand.notes:
Events can be configured to be high priority as well as what policy to use for sending it and what optional fields to include in the event report. The policy specify what mediums are allowed for communications and are configured in the "Communications" section.
This parameter is a bitfield where the bits have the following meanings:
Configuration = Bits 1,2,3 [0-7] : Policy, value between 0 and 7 Bit 4 : Not Used Bit 5 [16] : Include Location Optional Field Bit 6 [32] : Include Status Optional Field Bit 7 [64] : Event is High Priority Bit 8 [128] : Event is Enabled
How is this value calculated: As an example, configure the event to use policy 5, Include the Location Field, Include the Status Field and is enabled. Use the values in square brackets for each item and add them together, i.e. 5 + 16 + 32 + 128 = 181

unitCommand.name: Scope Debug Event Configuration
unitCommand.help: Scope Debug event is intended for Unit debug purposes only. Contact Scope Support before enabling this event
unitCommand.notes:
Events can be configured to be high priority as well as what policy to use for sending it and what optional fields to include in the event report. The policy specify what mediums are allowed for communications and are configured in the "Communications" section.
This parameter is a bitfield where the bits have the following meanings:
Configuration = Bits 1,2,3 [0-7] : Policy, value between 0 and 7 Bit 4 : Not Used Bit 5 [16] : Include Location Optional Field Bit 6 [32] : Include Status Optional Field Bit 7 [64] : Event is High Priority Bit 8 [128] : Event is Enabled
How is this value calculated: As an example, configure the event to use policy 5, Include the Location Field, Include the Status Field and is enabled. Use the values in square brackets for each item and add them together, i.e. 5 + 16 + 32 + 128 = 181

unitCommand.name: Enable Index Forced Default Triggers
unitCommand.help: Enable and disable default index forced event triggers
unitCommand.notes: This is a bit field of length 64 bits where each bit can switch a default index forced trigger ON or OFF. If the corresponding bit is 0 then the trigger is not scanned else it is scanned. The bytes are numbered from left to right and the bits inside each byte from right to left which means if you want to disable the second trigger you would set this value to: FDFFFFFFFFFFFFFF

unitCommand.name: Enable Scanned Default Triggers
unitCommand.help: Enable and disable default scanned event triggers
unitCommand.notes: This is a bit field of length 64 bits where each bit can switch a default scanned trigger ON or OFF. If the corresponding bit is 0 then the trigger is not scanned else it is scanned. The bytes are numbered from left to right and the bits inside each byte from right to left which means if you want to disable the second trigger you would set this value to: FDFFFFFFFFFFFFFF

unitCommand.name: Enable Forced Default Triggers
unitCommand.help: Enable Forced Default Triggers
unitCommand.notes: This is a bit field of length 64 bits where each bit can switch a default forced trigger ON or OFF. If the corresponding bit is 0 then the trigger is not scanned else it is scanned. The bytes are numbered from left to right and the bits inside each byte from right to left which means if you want to disable the second trigger you would set this value to: FDFFFFFFFFFFFFFF

unitCommand.name: Include Trigger ID
unitCommand.help: Include the Trigger ID in event reports so that the trigger responsible for the event can be identified
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
When an event is sent by the MHub, that event can be configured to include the Trigger ID of the trigger that caused the event. If this parameter is set to 1, then all events transmitted will include the trigger ID.

unitCommand.name: Geofence Entry and Exit debounce
unitCommand.help: Geofence Entry and Exit debounce ensure that travelling on the boundary of the geofence does not cause exsessive entry and exit events
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This value is used to specify the amount of time in seconds that a vehicle must be constantly in or out of a geofence before the event is generated. The reason for this is that if the vehcile is travelling directly on the border of a geofence, due to the bounce of the GPS location, the MHub may calculate the unit to be bouncing in annd out of the geofence. The entry and exit events must only be generated when the vehicle is definitely entered or exited the geofence.

unitCommand.name: Geofence Scanning Enabled
unitCommand.help: Geofence Scanning enabled or not
unitCommand.notes: If the geofence functionality of the MHub is to be used, this parameter must be set to 1 to enable the scanning of the geofences.

unitCommand.name: Geoloc Radius
unitCommand.help: Geoloc Radius
unitCommand.notes: When the geoloc geofence is automatically created around the current location of the MHub, this parameter specifies the radius of that geofence as a difference between two lat/long values.

unitCommand.name: Geoloc Debounce Time
unitCommand.help: Time the unit need to be outside the geoloc before a breach is triggered
unitCommand.notes: This is the time inseconds that the MHub needs to be outisde of the geoloc geofence before the Geoloc Breach event will be triggered.

unitCommand.name: Enable Geoloc Functionality
unitCommand.help: Switch the Geoloc functionality ON and OFF
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter to 1 will enable Geoloc functionality

unitCommand.name: Geoloc Trip End Enable
unitCommand.help: Enable Geoloc Trip End
unitCommand.notes: Enable the creation of a Geoloc, for current location, at Trip End. Geoloc will be disabled after ignition on

unitCommand.name: Geoloc Recovery Mode
unitCommand.help: Enable Geoloc Recovery Mode
unitCommand.notes: When Geoloc Recovery Mode is enabled and the Geoloc is Breached, Active Recovery mode is enabled. A Recovery Message is then sent every 30 seconds for 2 hours.

unitCommand.name: GPS Nmea Enable
unitCommand.help: GPS Nmea Enable
unitCommand.notes: The MHub can Output RS232 NMEA data to be used by an external device such as a PDA for input into a navigation program. Enabling this will turn ON the NMEA output onto Pin xx of the 15 way cable harnass. Baud rate is 19200

unitCommand.name: GPS Hardware Reset
unitCommand.help: Enable GPS Hardware Reset
unitCommand.notes: If this bit is set the unit may power-cycle to try and recover GPS lock

unitCommand.name: GPS PDA Nmea
unitCommand.help: GPS PDA Nmea encapsulated in 81-Protocol
unitCommand.notes: GPS PDA Nmea encapsulated in 81-Protocol

unitCommand.name: GPS Coordinate Distance
unitCommand.help: Calculate distance from GPS coordinates.
unitCommand.notes: If GPS speed is used to calculate trip distance, the accuracy of trip distance will be negatively affected when GPS lock is lost. By adding the distance between the last known position and position where GPS lock was obtained again, this error can be reduced.

unitCommand.name: GPS Antenna Event
unitCommand.help: Sends input 8 on/off event when GPS antenna is connected/disconnected
unitCommand.notes: Sends input 8 on/off event when GPS antenna is connected/disconnected

unitCommand.name: GPS Hardware Reset Time-Out
unitCommand.help: GPS Hardware Reset Time-Out
unitCommand.notes: GPS Hardware Reset Time-Out is the delay after a trip start after which it will power cycle the unit in case no GPS lock was acquired. This will recover the GPS in case of a GPS Module Lock-up. Minimum Time is checked and forced to 600seconds in code in case it is configured to a lower value.

unitCommand.name: External Modem Control Time
unitCommand.help: The amount of time that an external entity will be allowed control of the modem.
unitCommand.notes: The Mhub918 has a feature that will allow an external device such as a PC or PDA to take complete control of the modem. The Mhub will however only allow this for a certain maximum time. This parameter specifies the maximum amount of time in seconds that the MHub will relinquish control of the modem to an external device.

unitCommand.name: Access Point Node
unitCommand.help: Access Point Node identifier e.g. internet
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The APN (Access Point Node) is used when the Mhub will use GPRS to communicate with MProfiler. The GSM service provider will specify what APN Name should be used. A commonly used public APN is "internet" however not all networks will use this.

unitCommand.name: APN User Name
unitCommand.help: GSM Network supplied APN User Name
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
If the MHub is configured to communicate over GPRS, it needs to attach to the APN of the GSM service provider in order to communicate over GPRS. In some instances a GSM service provider may require that the MHub use a username when connecting to the APN. If no username is required, this parameter can be left blank.

unitCommand.name: APN Password
unitCommand.help: GSM Network supplied APN Password
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Hoe does this differ from the APN Password in 2425

unitCommand.name: Server IP Address
unitCommand.help: The IP address of the server that the external device wishes to open a socket to. This may be in the form of an IP address or URL in which case there must be a valid DNS IP configured.
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: TCP Port ID
unitCommand.help: TCP Port through which the socket will be opened to third party server.
unitCommand.notes: XXX - is this GSM external stuff still used. If not it must be removed.

unitCommand.name: External Control Hold State
unitCommand.help: The amount of time that the MHub will wait after a socket has closed before taking back control of the modem.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: External Socket Maximum allow time
unitCommand.help: The maximum amount of time that the MHub will allow control of the socket to be handled by an external device. When this timer has expired the socket will be closed. If a new request is initiated the socket will be immediately re-opened.
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: External Modem Control Enable
unitCommand.help: Enables control of the modem to be given over to an external device
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: External Socket Enable
unitCommand.help: Enables the opening of a socket before control is handed over to the external device
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: External PDP Context
unitCommand.help: PDP Context that must be used for the external socket. Note that all external socket settings will be written into this context. It should be different from the PDP context used by the socket used by the unit.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Maximum External Silence Time
unitCommand.help: Maximum time that there may be no traffic on the external modem interface before the MHub takes back control of the modem.
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: GPRS Mode
unitCommand.help: Sets TCP stack to work over GPRS or datacall
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Stack Start Retry Delay
unitCommand.help: Period of Stack Start retries.
unitCommand.notes: If the stack fails to connect to the APN it needs to be restarted. The amount of time in between restarts should be enough to allow the unit time to read any incoming SMS's that may contain new APN information that will allow a successful connection.

unitCommand.name: GPRS Domain Name Server Address
unitCommand.help: Domain Name Server IP address
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub communicates with the MProifler over GPRS, it opens up a socket to the Mprofiler server. In order to do this, the MHub is configured with the IP address of the MProfiler in parameter XXX. However instead of placing an IP address in this parameter, it is possible to use a url instead. If a url is used, then the MHub will need to know how to resolve the url to an IP address. This is done by a Domain Name Server. So this parameter contains the IP address of the Domain Name Server, when the MHub can then lookup the IP address of the MProfiler url. The disadvantage of using this mechanism, is that if the Mhub cannot contact the Domain Name Server, then it will not be able to get the IP of the Mprofiler, and will then not be able to send messages over GPRS.

unitCommand.name: GPRS Class Configuration
unitCommand.help: Sets the GPRS class of the modem. 0 - Do not set; 1 - Set to Class B; 2 - Set to class CG; 3 - Set to class CC
unitCommand.notes: This paramete allows for the setting of the GPRS Class of the Modem. In most instances the Mhub should never have to change the class of the modem, however it is possible for a GSM network to change the class of the modem, then the MHub may need to change it back. The value of this parameter defines to what class type the MHub will set the mode: 00 - MHub will not set the Modem Class 01 - MHub will set the modem to Class B 02 - Mhub will set the modem to Class CG 03 - MHub will set the Modem to Class CC For correct opetation of the MHUb, the modem should be set to class XXX

unitCommand.name: Access Point Node (APN Name)
unitCommand.help: Access Point Node identifier e.g. internet
unitCommand.notes: The APN (Access Point Node) is used when the Mhub will use GPRS to communicate with MProfiler. The GSM service provider will specify what APN Name should be used. A commonly used public APN is "internet" however not all networks will use this.

unitCommand.name: APN User Name
unitCommand.help: GSM Network supplied APN User Name
unitCommand.notes: If the MHub is configured to communicate over GPRS, it needs to attach to the APN of the GSM service provider in order to communicate over GPRS. In some instances a GSM service provider may require that the MHub use a username when connecting to the APN. If no username is required, this parameter can be left blank.

unitCommand.name: APN Password
unitCommand.help: GSM Network supplied APN Password
unitCommand.notes: If the MHub is configured to communicate over GPRS, it needs to attach to the APN of the GSM service provider in order to communicate over GPRS. In some instances a GSM service provider may require that the MHub use a passoword when connecting to the APN. If no passowrd is required, this parameter can be left blank.

unitCommand.name: Normal SMS Sending
unitCommand.help: Allows selection of GPRS SMS or Circuit switched SMS. This should not be changed from the default value unless there are network reasons. If this is changed SMS\'s will not work if there is no GPRS !
unitCommand.notes: In some GSM networks, it is possible to send a SMS from the MHub making use of the GPRS mechanism. There is generally no difference in the cost of sending the SMS, however the SMS will be sent faster. This should really only be used if the MHub is configured in such a way that will require sending many SMS messages quickly in succession. The disadvantage of using the method of sending SMS's, is that if the MHub finds itself outside of GPRS coverage, it will not be able to send the SMS, whereas if this option is turned off, the MHub would be able to send the SMS.

unitCommand.name: SMS First Octet
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: SMS Reference
unitCommand.help: This is set by the modem
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: SMS Validity Period
unitCommand.help: Validity time of a sent SMS.
unitCommand.notes: Specifies the validity period that the SMS will wait to be delivered for. the default of 180 is about 1 week.

unitCommand.name: SMS Protocol Identifier
unitCommand.help: Protocol identifier byte.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: SMS 7 bit coding scheme
unitCommand.help: 7 bit SMS coding Scheme
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: SMS 8 bit coding scheme
unitCommand.help: 8 bit SMS coding scheme
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: SMS Message Retry
unitCommand.help: Number of times that an SMS must be retried
unitCommand.notes: The parameter specifies the number of times that a SMS message will be retried if a send fails, before the message is discarded. Note that although the SMS may be discarded - if it is an event SMS, the same SMS will be regenerated again - so events will never be discarded

unitCommand.name: SMS International TON
unitCommand.help: International Type of number value

!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: SMS National TON
unitCommand.help: NAtional type of number
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: SMS PDU or Text
unitCommand.help: Sets SMS to PDU or Text mode.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Service Centre Address (1)
unitCommand.help: Primary Service Centre Address
unitCommand.notes: When communicating over SMS, the Service Center Address is used, this can also be called SMSC, and will be provided by the GSM service provider.

unitCommand.name: SMS Destination Address
unitCommand.help: The destination address of the next sms to be sent. This excludes event report sms\'s
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: Packet Size
unitCommand.help: The minimum data packet sent to the net.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE WITHOUT CONSULTING RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION.

unitCommand.name: Connection Timeout
unitCommand.help: Max connection establishment time.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE WITHOUT CONSULTING RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION.

unitCommand.name: Packet Transmission Timeout
unitCommand.help: Maximum amount of time that the modem will wait for a TCP packet to be filled before sending what it has.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE WITHOUT CONSULTING RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION.

unitCommand.name: Global Timeout
unitCommand.help: Socket Configuration: Max amount of time of the socket not going into active state (i.e. being suspended) before connection falls out.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
DO NOT CHANGE THIS VALUE WITHOUT CONSULTING RELEVANT DOCUMENTATION.

unitCommand.name: Maximum Message Completion time
unitCommand.help: This is the maximum amount of time that the unit will wait, after receiving a header, for the rest of a message to be received.
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub starts recieving data over GPRS, it needs to wait until the entire message has been recieved bofore it can start decoding the message. If the MHUb recieves only the forst part of the messaage, this parameter defines the time that the MHub will wait to recieve the remainder of the message. If the entire message is not recieved within this time. The MHub will discard the message.

unitCommand.name: Maximum Socket Login Attempts
unitCommand.help: The maximum number of attempts that a unit may make to login, before tearing down the socket.
unitCommand.notes: Using GPRS, the MHub will open a socket connection to the MProfiler server, and then attempt to login into MProfiler. If the login credentials on the MHub are incorrect, MProfiler will reject the the login attempt. This parameter specifies the number of time that the MHub will accept a rejection before closing the socket (XXX - Note - will Mprofiler ever close the socket in the event of incorrect logins)

unitCommand.name: Socket Transmission Timeout
unitCommand.help: The time that the (N)Ack may take to reach the MHub before the related transmission attempt expires.
unitCommand.notes: When the Mhub send data to the Mprofiler using GPRS, it always expects a message back from the Mprofiler, either a positive of negative acknowledge. However the Mhub will only wait a certain time for this reply from Mprofiler before the message attempt by the Mhub is expired. This parameter specifies the length of time that the MHub will wait for a response from Mprofiler, the default is usually 120 seconds.

unitCommand.name: Socket Block Time
unitCommand.help: The amount of time that establishment of a socket will be blocked after a socket is deliberately closed to allow for incoming voice or data calls.
unitCommand.notes: When the Mhub has an open socket to Mprofiler and and there is an incommng voice or data call. The MHub has to close the socket. After the call is completed, the MHub may then need to reopen the socket again. In the instance that say the voice call is dropped, and the caller makes the call to the MHub again, we not not want the Mprofiler to immediately open the socket again immediately just to have to close it again with the second call comes in. This parameter will set a time in seconds from when the socket is closed till when the MHub will open up the socket again

unitCommand.name: Maximum Socket Transmission Attempts
unitCommand.help: Maximum number of attempts the MHub will make to transmit a packet before the socket is torn down. The message is also failed.
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub transmits a message over GPRS to the MProfiler, tyhe MHub expects a response to that message. If it does not recieve the response with the time specified in parameter xxx, then the message is failed and needs to be resent. This parameter specifies the number of retries that the MHub will make to send a specific message before the message is failed completely. If the message is an event to be sent to Mprofiler, event though the specific message fails after all the retries, the event(s) will be resent at a later stage.

unitCommand.name: Socket Pre-Suspend Pause
unitCommand.help: Amount of time that the socket will wait before suspension so that current transactions are allowed to complete.
unitCommand.notes: Periodically the MHub needs to suspend the socket connection to Mprofiler in order to perform certain functions on the modem such as reading the signal strength. When the socket is about to be suspended, the MHub may still be waiting for a reply back from Mprofiler in response to having sent a message to Mprofiler. In this instance the MHub will wait for the time specified in this parameter for the response from Mprofiler.

unitCommand.name: Enable Suspend
unitCommand.help: Enables suspension of a socket for maintenance purposes
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter to 1 will allow the MHub to suspend the socket. Thus function is needed to be able to read some data from the modem such as the signal strength, or to look for an incomming SMS

unitCommand.name: Enable Socket Close
unitCommand.help: Enables the unit to close a socket so that voice and data calls may be dealt with
unitCommand.notes: In order to be able to answer an incomming voice call, the MHub must close a socket connection if it is currently open. Setting this parameter to 1 will allow the socket to be closed. If this is set to 0, then the MHUb will not be able to close the socket, and thus a voice call will not be possible.

unitCommand.name: Permanent TCP Socket
unitCommand.help: Enables a permanent TCP socket to MProfiler
unitCommand.notes: The ways in which the MHub can implement GPRS usage is very flexible, to be able to cater for various client requirements and customize such things as data usage etc. One method of GPRS operation is to specify that GPRS socket will remain permanently open. Enabling this parameter will instruct the MHub to open up a socket and attempt to keep the socket open at all time. Should the socket drop for any reason, the MHub will immediately reopen the socket again.

unitCommand.name: Data Triggered TCP Socket
unitCommand.help: when enabled the unit will only open a socket if there is data to be sent to MProfiler. This is overidden by the Permanent TCP Socket switch.
unitCommand.notes: The ways in which the MHub can implement GPRS usage is very flexible, to be able to cater for various client requirements and customize such things as data usage etc. One method of GPRS operation is to specify that GPRS socket will only be opened if there is data to be sent. Enabling this parameter will instruct the MHub to only open a socket to Mprofiler if there is data to be sent. Note that if the Permanent TCP Socket parameter is also enabled, that that will override this parameter.

unitCommand.name: Socket Suspend Time
unitCommand.help: Maximum amount of time that the GPRS socket may be suspended for the modem to take care of other tasks e.g handling SMS\'s
unitCommand.notes: In order to perform some tasks such as looking for SMS messages when there is an open GPRS socket, requires the MHub to suspend the socket for a while. This parameter specifies the maximum time in seconds for which the socket may be suspended

unitCommand.name: Socket Suspend Period
unitCommand.help: Number of seconds between successive suspends, i.e. Periodic suspend period
unitCommand.notes: When a socket is open, the MHub needs to suspend the socket occasionally to look for incomming SMS messages and do a few other things it can only do when the socket is suspended. This is a periodic task, and the value of this parameter dictates the suspension interval.

unitCommand.name: Allow GPRS Error Modem Reset
unitCommand.notes: Enabling this parameter allows error accumulation eventually leading to a modem reboot. This may be undesirable on networks that charge for APN connections.

unitCommand.name: Enable APN Reattachment
unitCommand.help: Perform APN reattachment during Socket Standoff period.
unitCommand.notes: This works in conjunction with the "Session Attempts Before Standoff" parameter. If this parameter is enabled then the MHub will do an APN reattachment during the standoff period.

unitCommand.name: Enable Suspend Report
unitCommand.help: Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when a socket is suspended
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub suspends a socket connection to Mprofiler, it is able to notify MProfiler that it is about to suspend the socket - just so that MProfiler knows about this. Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality

unitCommand.name: Enable Socket Close Report
unitCommand.help: Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when a socket is closed.
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub closes a socket connection to Mprofiler, it is able to notify MProfiler that it is about to close the socket. Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality

unitCommand.name: Enable Resume Report
unitCommand.help: Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when a socket is resumed after a suspend.
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub resumes a socket connection to Mprofiler after it has been suspended, it is able to notify MProfiler that it has resumed the socket connection. Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality.

unitCommand.name: Enable Power State Report
unitCommand.help: Enables the generation of notifications to MProfiler when the power state of the 801 changes.
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub changes its power state (Full, IDLe, SLEEP) it is able to notify MProfiler that it is about to change its power state.Setting this parameter to 1 will enable this functionality.

unitCommand.name: MProfiler Session Attempts Before Standoff
unitCommand.help: The number of attempts that the MHub will make to establish a session with MProfiler before the standoff period comes into effect.
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub attempts to make a GPRS connection to Mprofiler, and the attempt is not successful, it will try again. After a number of tries the MHub must assume that a login is not possible at this time, and then enters a standoff period where is will wait for a certain time before trying agan. This parameter specifies the number of login attempts before the standoff period kicks in.

unitCommand.name: TCP Session Standoff Period
unitCommand.help: The amount of time that the MHub will wait in between socket attempts after the maximum number of unsuccessful session attempts.
unitCommand.notes: After the standoff period starts as defined in parameter xxx, this parameter specifies the time in seconds that the standoff period will last before the MHub attempts to log into Mprofiler again.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Number 1 Enable

argument.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Number 1 Enable

unitCommand.help: Enables the Button Box to dial the number associated with Button 1 while the vehicle is moving.
unitCommand.notes: The voice dial filter is used to limit the use of a particular button while the vehicle exceeds a preset threshold. The threshold is set using the Trip Stationary Threshold found in the Trip subsection. If the relevant bit is set then the button is enabled while the vehicle's speed exceeds this threshold, but if it is cleared then the button is disabled until the vehicle slows to a speed below the threshold. There is no global enable parameter to overide this functionality.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Number 2 Enable

argument.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Number 2 Enable

unitCommand.help: Enables the Button Box to dial the number associated with Button 1 while the vehicle is moving.
unitCommand.notes: The voice dial filter is used to limit the use of a particular button while the vehicle exceeds a preset threshold. The threshold is set using the Trip Stationary Threshold found in the Trip subsection. If the relevant bit is set then the button is enabled while the vehicle's speed exceeds this threshold, but if it is cleared then the button is disabled until the vehicle slows to a speed below the threshold. There is no global enable parameter to overide this functionality.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Number 3 Enable

argument.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Number 3 Enable

unitCommand.help: Enables the Button Box to dial the number associated with Button 1 while the vehicle is moving.
unitCommand.notes: The voice dial filter is used to limit the use of a particular button while the vehicle exceeds a preset threshold. The threshold is set using the Trip Stationary Threshold found in the Trip subsection. If the relevant bit is set then the button is enabled while the vehicle's speed exceeds this threshold, but if it is cleared then the button is disabled until the vehicle slows to a speed below the threshold. There is no global enable parameter to overide this functionality.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Number 4 Enable

argument.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Number 4 Enable

unitCommand.help: Enables the Button Box to dial the number associated with Button 1 while the vehicle is moving.
unitCommand.notes: The voice dial filter is used to limit the use of a particular button while the vehicle exceeds a preset threshold. The threshold is set using the Trip Stationary Threshold found in the Trip subsection. If the relevant bit is set then the button is enabled while the vehicle's speed exceeds this threshold, but if it is cleared then the button is disabled until the vehicle slows to a speed below the threshold. There is no global enable parameter to overide this functionality.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Answer Enable

argument.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Answer Enable

unitCommand.help: Enables the Button Box to answer a call while the vehicle is moving.
unitCommand.notes: The voice dial filter is used to limit the use of a particular button while the vehicle exceeds a preset threshold. The threshold is set using the Trip Stationary Threshold found in the Trip subsection. If the relevant bit is set then the button is enabled while the vehicle's speed exceeds this threshold, but if it is cleared then the button is disabled until the vehicle slows to a speed below the threshold. There is no global enable parameter to overide this functionality.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Hangup Enable

argument.name: Voice Dial Moving Filter - Hangup Enable

unitCommand.help: Enables the Button Box to terminate a call (hangup) while the vehicle is moving.
unitCommand.notes:
The voice dial filter is used to limit the use of a particular button while the vehicle exceeds a preset threshold. The threshold is set using the Trip Stationary Threshold found in the Trip subsection. If the relevant bit is set then the button is enabled while the vehicle's speed exceeds this threshold, but if it is cleared then the button is disabled until the vehicle slows to a speed below the threshold. There is no global enable parameter to overide this functionality.
It is suggested that this button not be disabled to prevent the situation where a driver is unable to hangup a call.

unitCommand.name: Voice Call Auto Answer Ringcount Delay

argument.name: Voice Call Auto Answer Ringcount Delay

unitCommand.help: Number of rings that must occur before the call is answered by the MHub. If set to zero the MHub will answer the call as soon as it has detected a ring.
unitCommand.notes:
The MHub has the ability to answer an incoming voice call automatically so the driver does not have to be distracted. Voice Call Auto Answer has to be enabled via the Auto Answer Enable Parameter. It is suggested that it be used in conjunction with the Auto Answer While Moving Enable and the Voice Dial Moving Filters, so that the Button Box is disabled but incoming calls may still be answered without the driver's intervention.
NB: Make sure that the number of rings configured does not exceed the time allowed by the GSM network for an unanswered call.

unitCommand.name: Voice Call Auto Answer Always
unitCommand.help: Always answer any incoming voice call
unitCommand.notes: Always answer any incoming voice call automatically, after waiting for the amount of rings configured in Auto Answer Ring Count Delay.

unitCommand.name: Voice Call Auto Answer When Moving

argument.name: Voice Call Auto Answer When Moving

unitCommand.help: Automatically answer an incoming voice call while the vehicle is moving.
unitCommand.notes: While a vehicle is moving at a speed greater than the Trip Stationary Threshold answer any incoming voice call automatically, after waiting for the amount of rings configured in Auto Answer Ring Count Delay.

unitCommand.name: Scotch Call Enable
unitCommand.help: Enables the Scotch call control feature. NB: Remember to set up the Whitelist for the relevant MSISDNs. NB: Numbers in the Whitelist will not be able to call the unit using a voice call if this feature is enabled.

unitCommand.name: Scotch Call Enable Safe Mode Control

argument.name: Scotch Call Enable Safe Mode Control

unitCommand.help: Enables Safe Mode on/off toggling using the scotch call feature. Scotch call must be enabled.

unitCommand.name: Scotch Call Enable Trip Type Control

argument.name: Scotch Call Enable Trip Type Control

unitCommand.help: Allows a trip type to be toggled between business and private. Scotch call must be enabled.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial Input 1
unitCommand.help: Use Input 1 for Voice Dialing
unitCommand.notes: Use Input 1 for Voice Dialing. Enable Global Input Voice dialing with External Voice Dialing Enabled and Voice Dial with Inputs Enable.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial Input 2
unitCommand.help: Use Input 2 for Voice Dialing
unitCommand.notes: Use Input 2 for Voice Dialing. Enable Global Input Voice dialing with External Voice Dialing Enabled and Voice Dial with Inputs Enable.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial Input 3
unitCommand.help: Use Input 3 for Voice Dialing
unitCommand.notes: Use Input 3 for Voice Dialing. Enable Global Input Voice dialing with External Voice Dialing Enabled and Voice Dial with Inputs Enable.

unitCommand.name: Voice Number 1
unitCommand.help: Voice Number 1
unitCommand.notes: When the handsfree voice kit is connected to the MHub, the MHub has the ability to make and recieve telephone calls. However to limit calls from the MHub being made to any numbers, the voice kit can include a button box with 6 buttons, the will allow Answering and Hanging up of a voice call, and the ability to make a call to preset telephone numbers. One of these numbers is stored in this parameter.

unitCommand.name: Voice Number 2
unitCommand.help: Voice Number 2
unitCommand.notes: When the handsfree voice kit is connected to the MHub, the MHub has the ability to make and recieve telephone calls. However to limit calls from the MHub being made to any numbers, the voice kit can include a button box with 6 buttons, the will allow Answering and Hanging up of a voice call, and the ability to make a call to preset telephone numbers. One of these numbers is stored in this parameter.

unitCommand.name: Voice Number 3
unitCommand.help: Voice Number 3
unitCommand.notes: When the handsfree voice kit is connected to the MHub, the MHub has the ability to make and recieve telephone calls. However to limit calls from the MHub being made to any numbers, the voice kit can include a button box with 6 buttons, the will allow Answering and Hanging up of a voice call, and the ability to make a call to preset telephone numbers. One of these numbers is stored in this parameter.

unitCommand.name: Voice Number 4
unitCommand.help: Voice Number 4
unitCommand.notes: When the handsfree voice kit is connected to the MHub, the MHub has the ability to make and recieve telephone calls. However to limit calls from the MHub being made to any numbers, the voice kit can include a button box with 6 buttons, the will allow Answering and Hanging up of a voice call, and the ability to make a call to preset telephone numbers. One of these numbers is stored in this parameter.

unitCommand.name: External Voice dialing Enabled
unitCommand.help: Enable voice dialing from an external command
unitCommand.notes:
Enables Button Box, or other entity such as a PDA or MDT emulating button box, functionality including updating the Button Box or PDA as to the current Voice Call status.
If the LED's on the Button Box are not operating correctly check the status of this bit.

unitCommand.name: Enable Led Update
unitCommand.help: Enable Button Box LED Update message
unitCommand.notes: This bit enables un unsolicited command that is sent to a button box in order for the button box to be aware of the current Voice call state. This should be switched off for intelligent devices such as PDA's that are emulating a button box.

unitCommand.name: Voice Kit Power with Ignition
unitCommand.help: Voice Kit power follows ignition state.
unitCommand.notes: If set the voice kit will be powered while the ignition is swtiched on. If this bit is cleared then the voice kit will be switched on with an incoming or outgoing voice call and switched off when the call is terminated.

unitCommand.name: Enable PDA Voice Status Update
unitCommand.help: Enables a special PDA message to be sent to a PDA indicating the current call status. This must not be used with a button box.
unitCommand.notes: This should be used with the button box update switched off.

unitCommand.name: Voice Dial with Inputs Enable
unitCommand.help: Voice Dial with Inputs Enable
unitCommand.notes: Enable Inputs to control Voice Dialing. Input 1:3 - Button 1:3 Input 4 - Button 6

unitCommand.name: Incoming Voice Melody
unitCommand.help: Melody alert for incoming voice call
unitCommand.notes: When there is an imcoming voice call, there is a ring tone that indicates to the driver that there is an incoming call. This parameter can set the melody that is played for the ring tome. Values from 1 to 10 are permissable.

unitCommand.name: Incoming Voice Melody Volume
unitCommand.help: Volume of the ringer for incoming voice alerts
unitCommand.notes:
Incoming Voice Melody Volume is used to select the incoming call ringer sound level
0 - Off 1 - low 2 - middle 3 - high 4 - progressive

unitCommand.name: Enable System Log
unitCommand.help: Enable the system log
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Enable System Log Event: Info
unitCommand.help: Enable Sending Scope Debug Event for System Log Info Entries.
unitCommand.notes: Enable Sending Scope Debug Event for System Log Info Entries. Scope Debug Event has to be Configured.

unitCommand.name: Enable System Log Event: Warning
unitCommand.help: Enable Sending Scope Debug Event for System Log Warning Entries.

unitCommand.name: Enable System Log Event: Error
unitCommand.help: Enable Sending Scope Debug Event for System Log Error Entries.
unitCommand.notes: Enable Sending Scope Debug Event for System Log Info Entries.

unitCommand.name: Enable System Log Event: Failure
unitCommand.help: Enable Sending Scope Debug Event for System Log Failure Entries.

unitCommand.name: Enable System Log Event: Critical
unitCommand.help: Enable Sending Scope Debug Event for System Log Critical Entries.

unitCommand.notes:

None

unitCommand.name: GPRS Registration Message Format
unitCommand.help: GPRS Unsolicitied Status Message setting
unitCommand.notes:

None

unitCommand.name: SIM PIN
unitCommand.help: Sim PIN
unitCommand.notes: When a SIM card is used in the MHub that has a PIN which is not "00000", and the PIN Request on the SIM card is enabled, the value of that PIN is entered here. Great care must be taken to ensure that the PIN on the SIM matched the PIN programmed into this parameter. Faulure to ensure correct values here will result in the SIM being blocked, and then requiring the PUK.

unitCommand.name: Text White List Enable
unitCommand.help: Enables White List security for Text SMS commands.

unitCommand.name: Modem Band Selection
unitCommand.help: Selects the band that the modem must operate in: 0 - 900/1800 (European Standard) 1 - 900/1900 2 - 850/1800 3 - 850/1900 (USA, Mexico, Brazil) These settings are only used if Autoband is set to 0

unitCommand.name: Modem Autoband Enable
unitCommand.help: Enables the modem to automatically determine the frequency band that it must operate in.

unitCommand.name: SIM PIN Last Used
unitCommand.help: This is the PIN that was last used when requested by the GSM modem. This is modified by the unit and should not be edited.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Scope

unitCommand.name: PTCRB SIM Pre-Read Delay
unitCommand.help: The delay before the pin is used again. Necessary for PTCRB compliance.
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter invokes a delay before the unit reads the SIM card to prevent reads for sims of the incorrect voltage that are inserted. This must be set to 60 seconds for all units deployed in the USA

unitCommand.name: SIM Toolkit Interface Enable`
unitCommand.help: Enables the sim toolkit interface. This is only necessary for US applications. For the US set to 1 else set to 0.
unitCommand.notes: Enables the sim toolkit interface. This is only necessary for US applications. For the US set to 1 else set to 0.

unitCommand.name: No Network with Signal Timeout
unitCommand.help: If the modem detects a CREG of 2 but has a good CSQ reading i.e >10 for this number of seconds then is performs a network deregistration and re-registration.
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: IMEI (Last 9 Digits)
unitCommand.help: The last 9 digits of the IMEI stored as an integer
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The least significant digit of this number is a check digit that should ensure reasonable uniqueness of the number.

unitCommand.name: Calling Line Identification
unitCommand.help: Switches the calling line identification on or off. This allows the unit to know the origin of a voice or data call.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Reboot Limit
unitCommand.help: Maximum number of times that the modem can be soft rebooted before it is power cycled
unitCommand.notes: The MHub is fitted with a GSM modem. If the MHub detects a problem with the mode, it will attempt to reboot the modem by issuing a reboot command to the modem. If the error persists, another reboot command will be issued to the modem. This parameter specifies the number of time that the reboot command is sent to the modem before the MHub will power cycle the modem in an attempt to resolve a problem with the modem.

unitCommand.name: Cell Result Code
unitCommand.help: Enables extended reporting on incoming call type
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Data Rate Report
unitCommand.help: Enables report of data rate of established data call
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Flow Control DCE-by-DTE
unitCommand.help: DTE invokes flow control through RTS
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Flow Control DTE-by-DCE
unitCommand.help: DCE invokes flow control through CTS
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Service Reporting

unitCommand.name: Character Framing Format

unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Character Framing Parity
unitCommand.help: Type of parity.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Incoming Default Call
unitCommand.help: Sets the incoming call bearer when none is given by the network. Ref AT command set documnetation for value meanings. Defaults to voice.
unitCommand.notes: When a call is made to the MHub, it can be either a data call, fax call or voice call. The type of incomming call is called the Bearer Type. Now if this call is made from a mobile phone for instance, it will identify to the MHub which type of call it is (its Bearer Type). If the call is made from a fixed line operator, the MHub may not know what type of call it is. If the bearer type is not known to the MHub, then the MHub will have to apply a default Bearer Type. That is what this parameter defines. What Bearer Type must the MHub assign to an incomming call if the Bearer Type of the incomming call is unknown. The default for this is 2, which defines a voice call.

unitCommand.name: SMS Check Period
unitCommand.help: Number of seconds between checking for messages during maintenance cycles
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: Net Info Check Period
unitCommand.help: Number of seconds between checking net information during maintenance cycles
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: Wismo Power Save Enable
unitCommand.help: Enables the W32K power save functionality on the Wavecom Wismo
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: SMS Check Period in Power Save

argument.name: SMS Check Period in Power Save

unitCommand.help: Number of Minutes between checking for messages during maintenance cycles while the wismo is in W32k Power Save mode
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub is in sleep mode with the modem enabled for W32K power save mode, the modem is still able to recieve SMS messages even though it is in a very low power state. This parameter specifies the interval in minutes between which the MHub will check to see if the modem has received any SMS messages.

unitCommand.name: White List MSISDN 6

unitCommand.help: The amount of time that an AT command from outside the MHub will be allowed to complete execution before the MHub gathers the response.
unitCommand.notes: This parameter set the timeout for waiting for a response for an AT command sent from outside the MHub, i.e. via the external communications interface.
