unitCommand.name: Modem Auto Answer Ringcount
unitCommand.help: Number of rings before modem auto answers. 0 switches this feature off
unitCommand.notes: When the voice functionality of the MHub is used, it is possible to enable the Modem so that it will automatically answer incoming calls. This parameter will instruct the Modem after how many rings it must automatically answer the incoming voice call. If this parameter is set to 0, then the Modem will not automatically answer any incoming calls. This is not the recommended method of invoking Auto-Answer.

unitCommand.name: Audio Channel Selection
unitCommand.help: Speaker and microphone channel selection.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
0 - audio path follows the AXE input 1 - enables handsfree external mic/ear audio path 2 - enables internal mic/ear audio path

unitCommand.name: Side Tone Modifier 1
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Buzzer Channel Selection
unitCommand.help: Select Buzzer/Ringer Path
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
0 - sound output towards current selected audio path 1 - sound output towards handsfree 2 - sound output towards handset 3 - sound output towards Buzzer Output pin GPIO7

unitCommand.name: Microphone Gain
unitCommand.help: This sets the audio transmission gain.
unitCommand.notes: This value controls the gain of the microphone. 6 is the lowest gain and 0 represents the highest gain.

unitCommand.name: Speaker Volume
unitCommand.help: Sets the Speaker Gain.
unitCommand.notes: This parameter sets the amplification of the speaker signal, where 6 represents the lowest gain up to maximum at 0

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Cancellation Enable
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Cancellation Preset
unitCommand.help: Sets one of the preconfigured setups. If set to 0 then the configured parameters are not used and instead the modem\'s default settings are used.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Output Gain
unitCommand.help: Output Scaling
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
+6 offset i.e. -6 is configured as 0

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Adaptation Speed
unitCommand.help: LMS Adaptation speed.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Filter Length
unitCommand.help: LMS Filter Length (number of coefficients)
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Cancellation Rx/Tx Relation
unitCommand.help: Relationship of microphone to speaker signal power
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
+90 offset to real value. I.e. -90 is configured as 0; +90 is configured as 180

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Input Gain
unitCommand.help: Microphone line digital gain
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
+6 offset to configured value. I.e. -6 is configured as 0; +6 is configured as 12

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Noise Maximum Attenuation
unitCommand.help: Noise Maximum Attenuation
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Noise Reduction Weighting Factor 0

argument.name: Audio Echo Noise Reduction Weighting Factor 0

unitCommand.help: Noise reduction weighting factor band 300Hz - 500Hz.
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Side Tone Attenuation
unitCommand.help: Side tone attenuation factor
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This has a +1 offset. The default of -1 (0 with the offset) should not be changed as the sidetone messes with the echo cancellation.

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo Noise Reduction Weighting Factor 1

argument.name: Audio Echo Noise Reduction Weighting Factor 1

unitCommand.help: Noise reduction weighting factor band 500Hz - 4000Hz
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Standard Tone Sound Level
unitCommand.help: Sets the basic speaker level.

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo AGC Additional Attenuation
unitCommand.help: Automatic Gain Control additional attenuation.
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo AGC Minimum Attenuation
unitCommand.help: Minimum Gain Attenuation
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Audio Echo AGC Maximum Attenuation
unitCommand.help: Maximum Gain Attenuation
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Voice Mute Type
unitCommand.help: Determines the logic of the Voice mute
unitCommand.notes: This parameter determines the logic levels of the amplifier Mute signals. Set to 0 for Active high i.e. open collector output is OFF (high) for amplifier mute. This is for the Scope Amplifier. Set to 1 for Active low i.e. open collector output is ON (low) for amplifier mute.

unitCommand.name: TCP Port ID
unitCommand.help: TCP Port through which the socket will be opened
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub connects to MProfiler vis GPRS the Mhub opens up a socket to the MProfiler Server. This parameter specifies the port through which the socket will be opened.

unitCommand.name: TCP Socket Login Timeout
unitCommand.help: The amount of time that the unit will allow a login challenge to go unanswered before retrying.
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub opens a socket an logs into Mprofiler, the Mhub sends a specific login request. If it does not recieve a response to this request within the time specified by this parameter, it will resend the login request again. (XXX how does this compare to the other parameter that says about the same thing for response times)

unitCommand.name: MProfiler User Name
unitCommand.help: User name used when logging onto MProfiler over a TCP socket.
unitCommand.notes: When connecting to MProfiler using GPRS, the MHub needs to uniquely identify itself to MProfiler before the connection will be accepted. It identifies itself by means of the MProfiler User Name. before the connection will be acc epted, an entity on MProfiler must already exist with the same MProfier User Name as the UnitID on MProfiler. Care must be taken to ensure that no two MHub's are configured with the same MProfiler User Name, as then the information from two different MHub units will be sent o to the client application as a single unit. Typically the MSISDN of the SIM card can be used.

unitCommand.name: MProfiler User Password
unitCommand.help: Password used to log onto a TCP socket session with MProfiler.
unitCommand.notes: If the MProfiler login requires a password from the MHub whe the MHub logs into the Mprofiler, that password is stored in this parameter.

unitCommand.name: MProfiler MSISDN
unitCommand.help: MSISDN of the MProfiler SMS Gateway.
unitCommand.notes: The MHub always sends data to the MProfiler, this includes sending data to MProfiler via GPRS and SMS. When data is sent via SMS, the MHub needs to know where the SMS must be sent to - this will typically be a SMPP Gateway or even a modem directly connected to the MHub.

unitCommand.name: Text SMS Destination MSISDN
unitCommand.help: Destination MSISDN for Text messages
unitCommand.notes: The MHub has the ability to send a text message when an event occurs in addition to sending the message to Mprofiler. This parameter contains the MSISDN of the mobile phone to which the test message must be transmitted.

unitCommand.name: MProfiler IP
unitCommand.help: MProfiler IP address
unitCommand.notes: This is the IP Address of the MProfiler Server. It is used by the MHUb to know where to open up a socket to.

unitCommand.name: Rate of Change
unitCommand.help: Rate of Change in 1/10 of Degrees
unitCommand.notes: Rate of Change threshold in 1/10 of Degrees for tachograph event to be generated. 0 - Rate of Change is not taken into account

unitCommand.name: Direction Change Debouce
unitCommand.help: Direction Change Debounce in Seconds
unitCommand.notes: Direction Change Debounce in Seconds. Minimum time between Tachograph events or minimum time that direction needs to be static for event to be raised

unitCommand.name: Direction Change Minimum Speed
unitCommand.help: Direction Change Minimum Speed in km/h
unitCommand.notes: Direction Change Minimum Speed in km/h. Minimum speed required for Tachograph direction change event to be raised

unitCommand.name: Last Programmed Odometer
unitCommand.help: The last programmed odometer
unitCommand.notes: The last programmed odometer, used for callibration purposes

unitCommand.name: Temperature Report Interval
unitCommand.help: Periodic Temperature Report Interval
unitCommand.notes: The MHub is able to periodically send the values of all 4 the temperature sensors. This parameter specifies the interval in seconds for sending the Periodic Temperature Event.

unitCommand.name: Analog High Threshold
unitCommand.help: Analog High Threshold
unitCommand.notes: Analog High Threshold

unitCommand.name: Analog Low Threshold
unitCommand.help: Analog Low Threshold
unitCommand.notes: Analog Low Threshold

unitCommand.name: Analog Debounce
unitCommand.help: Analog Debounce
unitCommand.notes: Minimum time analog value has to be below or above threshold to trigger flag

unitCommand.name: Analog Rate-Of-Change Threshold
unitCommand.help: Analog Rate-Of-Change Threshold
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Analog Rate-Of-Change Threshold is the maximum allowed Analog value change over the analog debounce period

unitCommand.name: Analog G-Force Calibration X
unitCommand.help: Analog G-Force Calibration X
unitCommand.notes: Analog G-Force Calibration X

unitCommand.name: Analog G-Force Calibration Y
unitCommand.help: Analog G-Force Calibration Y
unitCommand.notes: Analog G-Force Calibration Y

unitCommand.name: Analog G-Force Limit X
unitCommand.help: Analog G-Force Limit X
unitCommand.notes: Analog G-Force Limit X - 0.1g to 25.5g

unitCommand.name: Analog G-Force Limit Y
unitCommand.help: Analog G-Force Limit Y
unitCommand.notes: Analog G-Force Limit Y - 0.1g to 25.5g

unitCommand.name: Analog General Usage
unitCommand.help: Analog General Usage
unitCommand.notes: Analog General Usage

unitCommand.name: Analog Accelerometer Usage
unitCommand.help: Analog Accelerometer Usage
unitCommand.notes: Analog Accelerometer Usage

unitCommand.name: Analog Fuel Usage
unitCommand.help: Analog Fuel Usage
unitCommand.notes: Analog Fuel Usage

unitCommand.name: Analog G-Force Axis Correction
unitCommand.help: G-Force Axis Correction
unitCommand.notes: G-Force Axis Correction to correct axis of G-forces to have valid Pitch And Roll

unitCommand.name: OBC RPM Loop
unitCommand.help: OBC RPM Timer Prescaler
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This parameter effectively defines the time period over which the RPM pulses are counted to calculate the actual RPM. A value of 10 could equate to 0.5 seconds.

unitCommand.name: OBC RPM Calibration
unitCommand.help: OBC RPM Calibration Value
unitCommand.notes: This is the RPM calibration factor.

unitCommand.name: OBC ODO Loop
unitCommand.help: OBC ODO Timer prescaler
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
This parameter effectively defines the time period over which the distance pulses are counted to calculate the actual distance and speed. A value of 20 could equate to 1 second.

unitCommand.name: OBC ODO Calibration
unitCommand.help: OBC ODO Calibration Value
unitCommand.notes: Calibration factor for the speed sensor input. This parameter contains the calibration factor that will convert the pulses recieved from the speed sensor into accurate distance, speed and acceleration values. The calibration factor is essentially the number of pulses receieved from the speed sensor when the vehicle travels 100m.

unitCommand.name: Position Report Interval - Idle
unitCommand.help: The period between successive periodic position reports if vehicle idle
unitCommand.notes: When a vehicle is travelling (ignition is ON) mostly it is required that the MHub will send events at regular intervals. This parameter specifies the interval in seconds between which the MHub will send Periodic Position events which the vehicle ignition is ON and it is in an excessive idle state.

unitCommand.name: Excessive Acceleration and Harsh Braking Delay

argument.name: Excessive Acceleration and Harsh Braking Delay

unitCommand.help: Delay used for Excessive Acceleration and Harsh Braking Event Generation
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub detects an excessive braking or acceleration violation, this parameter will specify the minimum duration in seconds of that violation before an exception event will be generated.

unitCommand.name: Excessive Idle Delay
unitCommand.help: Delay used for Excess Idle Event Generation
unitCommand.notes: Excessive Idle is when the vehicle is standing still with the ignition or engine still on. In order to prevent the excessive idle event being generated when the vehicle is simply stopped at a traffic light, this parameter will specify the minimum duration in seconds that the vechile must have been in the idle state before the vehicle is assumed to be in an excessive idle state. XXX - is 0 an appropriate default value?

unitCommand.name: Minimum Speeding Time
unitCommand.help: Minimum time of excessive speed before a Speeding Event is generated
unitCommand.notes: In order to provide a driver with a bit of leeway with redard to speeding - for instance when overtaking and exceeding the sped limit for only a short period, the MHub implements a minimum speeding time. The vehicle must therefopre be speeding for longer than the minimum time before a speeding event is generated. This parameter specifies that minimum speeding time in seconds.

unitCommand.name: Minimum Excess RPM Time
unitCommand.help: Minimum time of excessive RPM before a Excess RPM Event is generated
unitCommand.notes: This parameter will allow the RPM to exceed the configured limit for a time without the excessive RPM event being generated. If RPM remains above the limit for longer than the time specified in this parameter in seconds, then an exception event will be generated.

unitCommand.name: Speed Limit
unitCommand.help: The speed limit in km/h
unitCommand.notes: This is the speed limit in km/h above which the vehicle will be deemed to be speeding.

unitCommand.name: RPM Limit
unitCommand.help: RPM limit at which point an exception is occuring
unitCommand.notes: This is the RPM limit in x100 RPM units above which the vehicle will be deemed to be exceeding the RPM limit.

unitCommand.name: Position Report Interval
unitCommand.help: The period between sucessive periodic position reports during a trip
unitCommand.notes: When a vehicle is travelling (ignition is ON) mostly it is required that the MHub will send events at regular intervals. This parameter specifies the interval in seconds between which the MHub will send Periodic Position events which the vehicle ignition is ON and it is not in an excessive idle state.

unitCommand.name: Disable Speed Threshold
unitCommand.help: This value indicate the maximum speed threshold at which point it is safe to disable a vehicle
unitCommand.notes: The MHub has the ability to be connect to the vehicle in such a way that it is possible to immobilize the vehicle. The recommended way to connect into the vehcile for driver key and immobilizer usage is to connect to the starter motor of the vehicle. This will prevent the vehicle from being started unless a valid driver key is used. However it is also possible to connect the MHub in such a way that it will interrupt the ignition signal to the rest of the vehicle. This will also prevent the vehicle from being started unless a valid driver key is used, but this will also allow the vehcile to be immobilized and the engine turned OFF at any time. In order to provide some safety in this scenario, this parameter specifies a minimum speed, above which the vehcile will not be immobilized, even if instructed to do so.

unitCommand.name: Braking Limit
unitCommand.help: Braking Limit in km/h/s
unitCommand.notes: The MHub detects the acceleration and deceleration of the vehcile by using the speed sensor. If the MHub decelerates faster than the value specified in this parameter, is it deemed to be in the harch braking violation state. The units of this parameter is in km/h/s.

unitCommand.name: Acceleration Limit
unitCommand.help: Acceleration Limit in km/h/s
unitCommand.notes: The MHub detects the acceleration and deceleration of the vehcile by using the speed sensor. If the MHub accelerates faster than the value specified in this parameter, is it deemed to be in the excessive acceleration violation state. The units of this parameter is in km/h/s.

unitCommand.name: Non Trip Position Report Interval
unitCommand.help: Periodic Position while a trip is not in progress
unitCommand.notes: Similar to the Periodic Position Event, the MHub also has the ability to send an event when the ignition is OFF. The value of this parameter specifies the interval in seconds that the MHub will send the Non Trip Periodic events.

unitCommand.name: Ignition Source: Speed
unitCommand.help: Ignition Source: Speed
unitCommand.notes: One more possible source of ignition is to use Speed. If Speed is greater than the value specified in parameter "Ignition Source from RPM Threshold", the vehicle is moving. If speed is to be used as ignition, this parameter is set to 1.

unitCommand.name: Ignition Source: Ignition Line
unitCommand.help: Ignition Source: Ignition Line
unitCommand.notes: For correct operation of the Mhub in a vehicle, the MHub needs to know the state of the ignition line of the vehicle. There is however more than one way that the MHUb can detect the state of ignition. If the IGnition wire input of the MHub is conbnected to the ignition of the vehicle, then this value must be set to 1, and the MHub will use the ignition line as the source of ignition.

unitCommand.name: Ignition Source: Main Voltage
unitCommand.help: Ignition Source: Main Voltage
unitCommand.notes: In addition to being able to use the ignition line as the source of ignition for the MHub, to make an installation easier without having to connect the ignition line, the source fro ignition can be set to main voltage. To do this, this parameter is enable. If ignition is set to main voltage, the MHub will monitor the input voltage, and if it is above the threshold specified in "Ignition Source from Main Voltage Threshold", the ignition is ON, and below the threshold, ignition is OFF.

unitCommand.name: Ignition Source: RPM
unitCommand.help: Ignition Source: RPM
unitCommand.notes: One more possible source of ignition is to use RPM. If RPM is greater than the value specified in parameter "Ignition Source from RPM Threshold", the engine is running and the ignition is ON. If rpm is to be used as ignition, this parameter is set to 1.

unitCommand.name: Ignition Source: CAN
unitCommand.help: Ignition Source: CAN
unitCommand.notes: When CAN bus is used, this can also be used for the source of ignition.

unitCommand.name: Ignition Source: Trigger
unitCommand.help: Ignition Source: Trigger
unitCommand.notes: Ignition Source is set to Trigger which is a software controlled ignition source.

unitCommand.name: Ignition Source from RPM Threshold
unitCommand.help: RPM Threshold for Ignition On if Ignition Source from RPM
unitCommand.notes: When the source of ignition is set to RPM, the value of this parameter contains the threshold RPM above which the vehicles ignition is deemed to be ON.

unitCommand.name: Ignition Source from Main Voltage Threshold

argument.name: Ignition Source from Main Voltage Threshold

unitCommand.help: Main Voltage Threshold for Ignition On if Ignition Source from Main Voltage
unitCommand.notes:
When main voltage is used as the source of ignition, this parameter is the voltage threshold above which ignition will be assumed ON. Typically in a 12V vehicle this should be 13V, the parameter is in 100mv steps, thus the value of the parameter will be 130.
XXX - just a comment - what about a 24V vehicle, will 255 be enough - should the parameter no be increased to 16 bits?

unitCommand.name: OBC Sensor RPM
unitCommand.help: RPM sourced from sensor
unitCommand.notes: The MHub can take its source of RPM from various inputs. If RPM is determined by connecting the RPM wite to the "W" terminal, then this parameter must be set to 1.

unitCommand.name: OBC CAN RPM
unitCommand.help: RPM sourced from CAN
unitCommand.notes: The MHub can take its source of RPM from various inputs. If RPM is determined by using the RPM value read from the CAN Bus, then this parameter must be set to 1.

unitCommand.name: OBC Use CANBus
unitCommand.help: Enable J1939 CANBus Module
unitCommand.notes: If the CAN Bus is connected to the MHub918, this parameter needs to be set to 1 to enable the CAN Bus functionality.

unitCommand.name: OBC Active Can Bus
unitCommand.help: Enable Active CANBus Mode
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
If the CAN Bus is connected to the MHub918, this parameter needs to be set to 1 to enable Active CAN Bus functionality. Verify with vehicle manufacturer if the CanBus should be Active of Passive before setting this parameter.

unitCommand.name: Main Voltage Low Threshold
unitCommand.help: Threshold at which the Main Voltage is considered low.
unitCommand.notes: The MHub measures the state of the input voltage, and can generate an event if this input voltage drops too low. This parameter specifies the voltage threshold in 0.1V resolution.

unitCommand.name: Main Voltage Low Report Interval
unitCommand.help: Main Voltage Low Report Interval in seconds
unitCommand.notes: If a low main voltage input is detected, the MHub can be configured to send events until the main input voltage is back above the threshold in paramater "Main Voltage Low Threshold" again. This parameter specifies the the interval at which to send these periodic mains low events.

unitCommand.name: RPM Green Band High
unitCommand.help: Green Band RPM high limit
unitCommand.notes: Green Band RPM high limit in x 100

unitCommand.name: RPM Green Band Low
unitCommand.help: Green Band RPM low limit
unitCommand.notes: Green Band RPM Low limit in x 100

unitCommand.name: Ignition Source from Speed Threshold
unitCommand.help: Speed Threshold for Ignition On if Ignition Source from Speed
unitCommand.notes: When the source of ignition is set to Speed, the value of this parameter contains the threshold Speed above which the vehicles ignition is deemed to be ON.

unitCommand.name: Drive Slot 1 Start Time
unitCommand.help: Drive Slot 1 Start Time in Minutes from 00:00
unitCommand.notes: Drive Slot 1 Start Time in Minutes from 00:00

unitCommand.name: Drive Slot 1 End Time
unitCommand.help: Drive Slot 1 End Time in Minutes from 00:00
unitCommand.notes: Drive Slot 1 End Time in Minutes from 00:00

unitCommand.name: Drive Slot 2 Start Time
unitCommand.help: Drive Slot 2 Start Time in Minutes from 00:00
unitCommand.notes: Drive Slot 2 Start Time in Minutes from 00:00

unitCommand.name: Drive Slot 2 End Time
unitCommand.help: Drive Slot 2 End Time in Minutes from 00:00
unitCommand.notes: Drive Slot 2 End Time in Minutes from 00:00

unitCommand.name: Beeper Output Enable
unitCommand.help: Beeper Output Enable
unitCommand.notes: If a beeper is connected to the MHub, this parameter will enable or disable the beeper operation.

unitCommand.name: Driver Key Leds Enable
unitCommand.help: Driver Key Leds Enable
unitCommand.notes: The driver and passenger key reading receptacles have LED on them. This parameter will control whether those LED's are used or not.

unitCommand.name: Output 4 Follows Ignition
unitCommand.help: Output 4 Follows Ignition
unitCommand.notes: Output 4 Follows Ignition. If Driver Key Immobilisation is selected control will be handed over to Driver Key functionality

unitCommand.name: Global Vehicle Disablement Allowed
unitCommand.help: Global Vehicle Disablement Allowed
unitCommand.notes: if the Global Vehicle Disablement Allowed bit is set, a command can remotely disable the vehicle overriding the Driver Key.

unitCommand.name: Output 3 Used for Buzzer
unitCommand.help: Use Output 3 as Buzzer Output
unitCommand.notes: Output 3 can be configured to be controlled by the Buzzer control in addition of the Speaker beeper/ringer output.

unitCommand.name: Input 1 Active Tracking
unitCommand.help: Input 1 to trigger Active Tracking mode
unitCommand.notes: Input 1 to trigger Active Tracking mode

unitCommand.name: Always Update Odometer
unitCommand.help: Update Odometer even when Ignition or Trip is false.
unitCommand.notes: Update Odometer even when Ignition or Trip is false. Odometer reading is not normally updated outside of a trip or when ignition off because of GPS drift, E.g. Gps Position changes when vehicle is stationary, because it can cause big odometer errors.

unitCommand.name: OBC Free Wheeling Debounce
unitCommand.help: OBC Free Wheeling Debounce
unitCommand.notes: The MHub can detect freewheeling. This is where the driver of a vehicle depresses the clutch while still travelling at a relatively high speed. This is deemed to be a bad driving practise. It is detected when the RPM is below the threshold specified in "Free Wheel RPM Threshold", and the speed is above the threshold specified in "Speed Free Wheel Threshold". It may however be permissable to freewheel for a short period of time. This parameter specifies the minimum amount of time in seconds above which the event will be generated.

unitCommand.name: Free Wheel RPM Threshold
unitCommand.help: RPM High limit for Free Wheel condition
unitCommand.notes: This is the freewheeling RPM threshold on units of x100 RPM. When the vehicle RPM is below this value, and the speed is above the value specified in parameter "Speed Free Wheel Threshold", and this condition persists for more than the time specified in "OBC Free Wheeling Debounce", then the vehicle in in a state of freewheeling, and a freewheeling event can be generated.

unitCommand.name: Speed Free Wheel Threshold
unitCommand.help: Speed minimum limit for Free Wheel condition
unitCommand.notes: Freewheeling speed threshold in km/h. When the vehicle speed is above this value, and the RPM is below the value specified in parameter "Free Wheel RPM Threshold", and this condition persists for more than the time specified in "OBC Free Wheeling Debounce", then the vehicle in in a state of freewheeling, and a freewheeling event can be generated.

unitCommand.name: Auto Calibration Activation
unitCommand.help: Auto Calibration Activation
unitCommand.notes: When the source for speed or distance is set to the speed sensor, it is required that the sensor be calibrated first before the vehcile can be used for the readings to be accurate. This is typically done by programming the calibration factor (parameter "OBC ODO Calibration"). There is however an automated way of doing this. The Mhub is aware of its speed in anycase from the GPS sensor, so it is possible to use the GPS sensor to calibrate the speed sensor. If automatic calubration is required, this parameter is set to 1, and the MHub will then attempt to calibrate itself. Once the MHub has successfully calibrated itself, it will clear this parameter to 0.

unitCommand.name: Auto Calibration Speed Threshold
unitCommand.help: Auto Calibration Speed Min Speed
unitCommand.notes:
When the source for speed or distance is set to the speed sensor, it is required that the sensor be calibrated first before the vehcile can be used for the readings to be accurate. This is typically done by programming the calibration factor (parameter "OBC ODO Calibration"). There is however an automated way of doing this. The Mhub is aware of its speed in anycase from the GPS sensor, so it is possible to use the GPS sensor to calibrate the speed sensor. If automatic calubration is required, the parameter "Auto Calibration Activation" is set to 1, and the MHub will then attempt to calibrate itself. This parameter specifies the minimum speed that the MHub will use to calibrate itself.
In order to calibrate itself, the Vehicle must travel at a constant speed of greater than the value in this parameter for the time duration specified in "Auto Calibration Debounce".

unitCommand.name: Auto Calibration Debounce
unitCommand.help: Auto Calibration Debounce debounce time in seconds
unitCommand.notes: This parameter specifies for how long the vehicle must travel in seconds at a constant speed above the value specified in parameter "Auto Calibration Speed Threshold" for Auto Calibration to occur.

unitCommand.name: MHub Description
unitCommand.help: MHub Description
unitCommand.notes: This text description of the MHub in this parameter is used when sending a text SMS event.

unitCommand.name: Tacho Graph Report Interval
unitCommand.help: Tacho Graph Reporting Interval
unitCommand.notes: The tachograph event is similar to the periodic position event. This event is defined for backward compatibity with older hardware

unitCommand.name: OBC GPS Speed
unitCommand.help: OBC GPS Speed
unitCommand.notes: Setting the unit to use GPS as it's speed source

unitCommand.name: OBC CAN Speed
unitCommand.help: OBC CAN Speed
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: OBC Sensor Speed
unitCommand.help: OBC Sensor Speed
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: OBC Sensor Odometer
unitCommand.help: OBC Sensor Odometer
unitCommand.notes: This is the odometer reading of the MHub. although the MHub will increment it as required. The initial value is programmed into this parameter.

unitCommand.name: OBC GPS Odometer
unitCommand.help: OBC GPS Odometer
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: OBC CAN Odometer
unitCommand.help: OBC CAN Odometer
unitCommand.notes: None

unitCommand.name: OBC High Res. Calibration
unitCommand.help: High resolution Odometer calibration
unitCommand.notes: This bit enables high resolution Odometer calibration.

unitCommand.name: OBC Ignition Minute Odometer
unitCommand.help: OBC Ignition Minute Odometer
unitCommand.notes: For stationary applications Ignition On minutes can be used as Odometer source. Hence Service Events can be raised based on Engine Minutes. 1 Minute = 1 Meter

unitCommand.name: Output 1 Style
unitCommand.help: Output Style for Output 1: 0 - Normal, 1 - Timed, 2 - Progressive, 3 - Pattern
unitCommand.notes: There are 4 different styles of outputs: 00 = Normal - this is where the output will be either ON or OFF. 01 = Timed - This is where a style map will run for the number of seconds specified in the "Style count" parameter, and then go OFF. 02 = Progressive - The Style Map must be set to progressive. Shift by count bits. 03 - Pattern - This is where the Style Map is applied to the output and repeats every two seconds indefinitely until the output is turned OFF.

unitCommand.name: Output 1 Style Repeat Count
unitCommand.help: Output Style Repeat Count 1 for Timed Outputs
unitCommand.notes:
This parameter is used when the output style is set to timed outputs. The value of this paramneter will then specify the number of times that the style map is repeated. The style map is 2 seconds long.
This parameter is also used when the output style is set to progressive. In this instance the value of the repeat count indicates how much longer each sucessive progressive pulse will be. Do not use any values other than indicated below when progressive style is used. 1 = 100ms 3 = 200ms 7 = 300ms 15 = 400ms 31 = 500ms 63 = 600ms 127 = 700ms 255 = 800ms

unitCommand.name: Output 1 Style Map
unitCommand.help: Output Style Map 1 for Pattern and Progressive Output
unitCommand.notes: The style Map is used when the output style is set to timed. The output style map is essentially a 20 bit value where each bit represents 100ms, thus the style map takes 2 seconds to complete one cycle, and if a bit in the map is set to 1, the output will be ON, and if a bit is set to zero, the output will be OFF.

unitCommand.name: Receive SMS RI Pulse Length
unitCommand.help: Sets the pulse length of the Ring Indicator. 0 Switches it off. Valid range is 50 - 1150.
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: PDA Off Delay
unitCommand.help: Delay for PDA Power Down with ignition off in seconds
unitCommand.notes: Delay for PDA Power Down with ignition off in seconds

unitCommand.name: Enable Sleep Mode
unitCommand.help: Enable Unit Sleep Mode 0: Normal 1: Sleep Mode
unitCommand.notes: This parameter will allow the MHub to enter the sleep state. This is the lowest power state of the MHub. 1=Enable

unitCommand.name: Enable IDLE Power Mode
unitCommand.help: GPS to idle power mode. Updates position every 30 seconds. GPS Speed and direction not available. 0: Normal 1: Idle Mode
unitCommand.notes: This parameter will allow the Mhub to enter into its IDLE power save mode. In the idle state, GPS positions are updated internally to the MHub every 30 seconds, and speed and direction values are not available. 1=Enable Idle Mode

unitCommand.name: Enable Sleep Modem Scan
unitCommand.help: Unit wakes up periodically from sleep to check for messages if Ultra Low Power Mode is disabled.
unitCommand.notes: When sleep mode is enabled, and the MHub has entered sleep mode, it is possible to configure the MHub to still periodically wake up and check to see if there are any SMS messages that have been sent to the MHub while it was in sleep mode. Setting this parameter will enable this functionality.

unitCommand.name: Enable Modem Power off in Sleep

argument.name: Enable Modem Power off in Sleep

unitCommand.help: NOT USED - Enable Modem Power off in Sleep. 0: Modem Idle Mode(W32) 1: Modem Off
unitCommand.notes: NOT USED - When the Mhub has enetered sleep mode, the modem can either be turned OFF, or it can enter an idle mode. This idle mode of the modem is called W32K mode, and placed the modem into a very low power state, but still giving the modem the ability to recieve an SMS. If teh modem is turned OFF, it cannit recieve a SMS. This parameter will dictate which power mode for the modem to use: 0: Modem Idle Mode(W32) 1: Modem Off

unitCommand.name: Enable Deep Sleep Power Mode
unitCommand.help: Enable Deep Sleep Power Mode: Master Clock running 32Khz. Modem Sleep Scan Not Available. Wake-up from Ignition Only.
unitCommand.notes: In addition to the IDLE and SLEEP power modes of the Mhub, there is also an Deep Sleep Power state, where the MHub will only wake up from the ignition line being turned ON. It cannot periodically wake up to check for incomming messages. Setting this parameter will enable this Deep Sleep Power Mode.

unitCommand.name: Enable Modem W32 Sleep Scan
unitCommand.help: NOT USED - Sleep scan mode from sleep will be entered by Modem Activity. This is dependant on network e.g. Unpredictable.
unitCommand.notes: NOT USED - When the Mhub is in SLEEP mode, and the modem enabled to be in W32K idle mode, the modem is able to recieve a SMS message. Now ehen the modem recieves a SMS message, it will send a message to the MHub, the mhub will then wake up and read the SMS from the modem. The drawback of this is that the MHub will wake up if anything is sent from the modem to the MHub. For instance if for some reason the modem switches to a different GSM tower while in W32K mode, it will also send a message to the MHub, and the MHub will then wake up - see that there is not really a SMS, and go back to SLEEP modem again. Thus the Mhub wakes up from sleep mode without really having to. Setting this value to 1 will enable this functionality.

unitCommand.name: Power Mode time to IDLE
unitCommand.help: Time in seconds to IDLE Mode
unitCommand.notes: This parameter specifies in seconds how long the MHub will wait in full power mode after ignition is turned off until it enters IDLE mode. Idle mode must be enable in parameter "Enable IDLE Power Mode" before this will take effect.

unitCommand.name: Power Mode time to Sleep
unitCommand.help: Time in seconds to Sleep Mode
unitCommand.notes: This parameter specifies in seconds how long the MHub will wait in IDLE power mode before it enters IDLE mode. Sleep mode must be enable in parameter "Enable Sleep Mode" before this will take effect.

unitCommand.name: Power Mode time to Deep Sleep

argument.name: Power Mode time to Deep Sleep

unitCommand.help: Power Mode time to Deep Sleep
unitCommand.notes: This parameter specifies in seconds how long the MHub will wait from IDLE power mode before it enters Deep Sleepmode. Deep Sleep mode must be enable in parameter "Enable Deep Sleep Mode" before this will take effect.

unitCommand.name: Power Sleep Mode Enabled
unitCommand.help: Global Power Sleep Mode Enablement variable. Program with value 0xCC to enable power sleep mode and any other value to disable.
unitCommand.notes: Global Power Sleep Mode Enablement variable. Program with value 0xCC to enable power sleep mode and any other value to disable.

unitCommand.name: Daily Reset Enable
unitCommand.help: Daily Reset Enable
unitCommand.notes: The MHub has the ability to reset itself once a day. Setting this to 1 will enable this daily reset.

unitCommand.name: Hardware Reset Enable
unitCommand.help: Hardware Reset Enable when doing daily reset
unitCommand.notes: When the daily reset is executed, it is only a restart of the system program. If this bit is set, the daily reset will also perform a hardware reset of the various components of the MHub as well.

unitCommand.name: Daily Reset Time
unitCommand.help: Daily Reset Time
unitCommand.notes: If the daily reset is enabled in parameter "Daily Reset Enable", this parameter will specify the time offset in minutes from midnight at which time the reste will occur. Keep in mind that the MHUhb operates only on GMT (UTC) time.

unitCommand.name: Power Mode time to Sleep Scan

argument.name: Power Mode time to Sleep Scan

unitCommand.help: Time in seconds to Sleep Modem Scan
unitCommand.notes: When the unit is configured for Sleep mode it has to wake up every now and again to scan for any message that it might have received while sleeping. This parameter sets that time (in seconds)

unitCommand.name: Time delay from Modem Power Down to sleep

argument.name: Time delay from Modem Power Down to sleep

unitCommand.help: Time in seconds allowed for Modem Power Down
unitCommand.notes: When the unit is configured for sleep mode it first powers the modem down and then goes into sleep mode. This parameters set the time in seconds from when the modem is powered down to when the unit goes into sleep mode.

unitCommand.name: Power Mode Time To Sleep From Sleep Scan

argument.name: Power Mode Time To Sleep From Sleep Scan

unitCommand.help: Time in Seconds to Sleep from Sleep Scan Mode
unitCommand.notes: When the unit is configured for Sleep mode it has to wake up every now and again to scan for any message that it might have received while sleeping. After it woke up it has to go back to sleep after a set time. This parameter sets that time (in seconds)

unitCommand.name: RTC Wake-Up Time 0
unitCommand.help: RTC Wake-Up Time 0 in Minutes from 00:00
unitCommand.notes: This is one of the 4 times that are used to specify at what time the MHub802 will wake up. IT is minutes taken from midnight GMT (UTC)

unitCommand.name: RTC Wake-Up Time 1
unitCommand.help: RTC Wake-Up Time 1 in Minutes from 00:00
unitCommand.notes: See RTC Wake-UP Time 0

unitCommand.name: RTC Wake-Up Time 2
unitCommand.help: RTC Wake-Up Time 2 in Minutes from 00:00
unitCommand.notes: See RTC Wake-UP Time 0

unitCommand.name: RTC Wake-Up Time 3
unitCommand.help: RTC Wake-Up Time 3 in Minutes from 00:00
unitCommand.notes: See RTC Wake-UP Time 0

unitCommand.name: Sealed Unit Enable
unitCommand.help: This indicates if the MHub is a sealed unit or not.
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub is an 802 unit. This parameter is set, that enables specific MHub802 functioality - XXX change this to MHub802 mode. Let's stop calling it sealed unit.

unitCommand.name: Sealed Unit GPS off after lock

argument.name: Sealed Unit GPS off after lock

unitCommand.help: If set GPS goes to low power mode after 3D lock
unitCommand.notes: The principle behind the long battery life of the MHub802 is that it perform its required functions as quickly as possible, and then turn off again. When the MHub802 turn ON, it needs to register on the GSM network, wait for a GPS position to be computed, send the SMS and then shut down again. If a GPS position is attained before the GSM network registration is achieved, it makes no real sense to keep the GPS on. However one the MHub has a valid GPS lock, remaining ON may actually improve the accuracy of that position somewhat. However in most instances the initial 3D lock is acceptable. This parameter specifies that the GPS must turn OFF immedaitely after getting a 3D lock. If set to 1, the GPS will trun OFF immediately after a 3D lock

unitCommand.name: Enable Test Event
unitCommand.help: ABSOLETE: Enable Test Event
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
Not used

unitCommand.name: RTC Offset Type
unitCommand.help: _X: RTC Time Offset from 00:00 X_: RTC Periodic Offset from current time XX: RTC HH:MM Offset from 00:00
unitCommand.notes: The operation of the MHub802 is such that it wakes up, send a message and switches off again. 1(01 old) = RTC Time Offset. This tells the MHub that the value stored in the Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time are minute intervals from 12:00 midnight at which to wake up. e.g. Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time = 360, unit will wake up 06:00, 12:00, 18:00 and 00:00 2(10 old) = RTC Periodic Offset. This tells the MHub that the value stored in the Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time are minutes from the current time at which to wake up again. Sealed Unit RTC Wake-up time = 360, if the current time is 13:09 the next wake up time will be 19:09 3(11 old) = RTC HH:MM Offset. There are 4 parameters that are used to specify the time that the MHub802 must wake up. This parameter specifies how these 4 time parameters are interpreted by the MHub802. The 4 time parameters are RTC Wake-Up Time 0 to 3 and entered in minutes.

unitCommand.name: Time on after event sent
unitCommand.help: This is the time in seconds the unit should stay ON after the wakeup event was sent
unitCommand.notes:
XXX - What wakeup event.
After the MHub802 has sent the event, it is possible that there may have been a message that has been sent to the MHub802. And thus some time needs to be allowed to be able to recieve that event. This parameter specifies the time in seconds that the MHUb802 will remain ON after the event has been sent.

unitCommand.name: Sealed Unit RTC wake-up time
unitCommand.help: Sealed Unit RTC wake-up time in Minutes
unitCommand.notes: This is the timer that is used with the mode is set to XXX. Time is in minutes - Really should write somehting better here

unitCommand.name: Maximum ON Time with Ignition
unitCommand.help: Maximum on time in seconds with ignition on
unitCommand.notes:
XXX - Change this to tamper instead of ignition
The Mhub802 can be mounted with a tamper detection in place so that if it is removed from its mounting place, it will wake up immediately. This operation is outside of the noemal operation of the MHub802. When the tamper it triggered, this parameter specifies for how long the MHub801 will remain on before turning OFF again. Note that it the tamper detection is still triggererd by the time the MHub is supposed to turn OFF again, it will not turn OFF.

unitCommand.name: Force Wakeup Event Timeout
unitCommand.help: This is the time in seconds before forcing the unit to send the Wakeup event even when it does not have a 3D GPS lock
unitCommand.notes: When the MHub802 wakes up, one of its tasks is to get a 3D GPS lock as quickly as possible. However it may be that it is impossible for the MHub802 to get a GPS location at all. To prevent the MHub802 from staying ON for too long and thus reducing the battery life, this parameter specifies a maximum time in seconds that the MHub802 will wait for a 3D GPS lock. If a lock is not achieved after waiting this amount of time, the event will be sent in anyway, indicating that the GPS lock wan not valid.

unitCommand.name: Geoloc Breach Periodic Position
unitCommand.help: Periodic Positions for when the geoloc has been breached - in seconds
unitCommand.notes: The Mhub802 has geoloc functionality, whereby a command is sent to the MHub802 that will cause it to create a geofence around its current location. Every time the MHub802 wakes up, the location is checked to see if it is still inside this geoloc geofence. If it is outside of the geofence, the MHub802 will enter an Alarm mode and will send periodic locations at the interval specified by this parameter in seconds.

unitCommand.name: Emergency Mode Periodic Position Interval
unitCommand.help: Periodic Position Interval when the unit is in Emergency Mode - in seconds
unitCommand.notes: This is where an emergency event is sent to the MHub to place it into an Emergency mode. In this mode this parameter specifies the time interval in seconds that periodic positions will be sent.

unitCommand.name: Tamper Mode Periodic Position Interval
unitCommand.help: Periodic Position Interval for when the unit is in Tamper Mode - in seconds
unitCommand.notes: The tamper mode described in XXX will also result in the MHub802 sending periodic location events. This parameter specifies the interval at which the MHub802 will send periodic events while in Tamper mode.

unitCommand.name: Time to wait for GPS Lock

argument.name: Time to wait for GPS Lock

unitCommand.help: Time in seconds to wait for a good GPS Lock
unitCommand.notes: This is the maximum time in seconds that the MHub will wait to get a GPS position, if it does not have a valid position at the end of this time, the MHub will turn off.

unitCommand.name: Time to wait for GSM coverage

argument.name: Time to wait for GSM coverage

unitCommand.help: Time in seconds to wait for GSM Network coverage
unitCommand.notes: This is the maximum time in seconds that the MHub will wait to register onto the GSM network, if it does not register onto the network by the end of this time, it will turn off.

unitCommand.name: Maximum ON Time
unitCommand.help: Maximum time in seconds the unit should stay ON when something causes any of the logic not to work out
unitCommand.notes: This parameter specifies the maximum time that the MHub802 will remain on under normal operating instances. So if both GSM and GPS are OK, but the MHub cannot send the SMS, or has too many sms's to send, it will turn OFF after this time.

unitCommand.name: Service Interval
unitCommand.help: Service Interval in meters
unitCommand.notes: Service Events will be raised every Service Interval boundary. If 0 this functionality is switched off.

unitCommand.name: Service Odometer 1
unitCommand.help: Next Service Odometer Reading 1
unitCommand.notes:
The Mhub can be programmed to generate events when a service is due. This is done by comparing the current odometer readin to that of the odometer readings programmed into one of the 8 Service Odometer parameters.
XXX - there is obviously some parameter that will specify what distance prior to the Service Odometer the MHub must generate the event, and obviously some mechanism that will prevent this message from being generated multiple times.

unitCommand.name: Temperature Sensor 1 ID
unitCommand.help: Temperature Sensor 1 ID
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

unitCommand.name: Temperature Sensor 2 ID
unitCommand.help: Temperature Sensor 2 ID
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

unitCommand.name: Temperature Sensor 3 ID
unitCommand.help: Temperature Sensor 3 ID
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

unitCommand.name: Temperature Sensor 4 ID
unitCommand.help: Temperature Sensor 4 ID
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
The MHub has the ability to connect to up to a maximum of 4 temperature sensors. The temperature sensors are pre calibrated digital temperature sensors, and all communicate to the MHub by means of the same communications wire. In order for the MHub to know which of the 4 sensors it is communicating with, this parameter is programmed with the ID value of one of the temperature sensors.

unitCommand.name: Temperature 1 High Threshold
unitCommand.help: Temperature 1 High Threshold
unitCommand.notes: The value of this parameter specifies the high temperature threshold of temperature sensor 1. Note that the units of this parameter are celcius+50. Thus if the value for the high threshold is to be -10 celcius.

unitCommand.name: Temperature 1 Low Threshold
unitCommand.help: Temperature 1 Low Threshold
unitCommand.notes: The value of this parameter specifies the low temperature threshold of temperature sensor 1. Note that the units of this parameter are celcius+50. Thus if the value for the high threshold is to be -10 celcius.

unitCommand.name: Temperature 2 High Threshold
unitCommand.help: Temperature 2 High Threshold
unitCommand.notes: See Temperature 1 High Threshold

unitCommand.name: Temperature 2 Low Threshold
unitCommand.help: Temperature 2 Low Threshold
unitCommand.notes: See Temperature 1 Low Threshold

unitCommand.name: Temperature 3 High Threshold
unitCommand.help: Temperature 3 High Threshold
unitCommand.notes: See Temperature 1 High Threshold

unitCommand.name: Temperature 3 Low Threshold
unitCommand.help: Temperature 3 Low Threshold
unitCommand.notes: See Temperature 1 Low Threshold

unitCommand.name: Temperature 4 High Threshold
unitCommand.help: Temperature 4 High Threshold
unitCommand.notes: See Temperature 1 High Threshold

unitCommand.name: Temperature 4 Low Threshold
unitCommand.help: Temperature 4 Low Threshold
unitCommand.notes: See Temperature 1 Low Threshold

unitCommand.name: Periodic Temperature only in Trip
unitCommand.help: Periodic Temperature event will only be sent inside trip
unitCommand.notes: 0 - Periodic Temperature Event always sent >0 - Periodic Temperature Event sent only in Trip

unitCommand.name: Trip Start Delay
unitCommand.help: Delay after Ignition on before trip start indication
unitCommand.notes: When starting a vehicle, the cranking of the engine may result in the battery voltage fluctuating substantially, enough so to cause the ignition detection of the MHub to detect multiple ON/OFF transitions on the ignition line. Also if a driver is struggling to start a vehicle, the driver may attempt a number of sarts before the vehicle finally starts. In these cases the MHub should not generate many trip start end end events. In order to prevent multiple start and end events, this parameter will specify the time in seconds over hich the ignition line must be constantly ON before a valid trip start is detected. The default parameter is 10 seconds

unitCommand.name: Trip End Delay
unitCommand.help: Delay after Ignition off before trip end indication
unitCommand.notes: This is similar to the trip start delay, whereby after ignition is turned off, the MHUb will wait for the number of seconds before generating the Trip End Event.

unitCommand.name: Trip Stationary Threshold
unitCommand.help: Speed Threshold at what vehicle is considered stationary
unitCommand.notes: It is possible to configure the MHub so that even if a vehicle is travelling very slowly, it is still deemed to be idling (standing still). This is also used to combat the effects of GPS speed jumps. Sometimes when a vehicle is stationary, the GPS sensor can report low speeds occasionally. Now if the vehicle is supposed to be in an Idle exception state at that time, it is important that the GPS reporting a speed of say 2KM/h does not cancel the excessive idle state. This parameter is used to specify the a speed in km/h below which the vehicle is deemed stationary.

unitCommand.name: Trip Speed from Sensor
unitCommand.help: Trip Speed from Sensor
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed sensor input as a source for speed of the MHub. Note that it is important that the speed calibration is correctly done and is accurate when using the speed sensor as the source of speed.

unitCommand.name: Trip Speed from GPS
unitCommand.help: Trip Speed from GPS
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed provided by the GPS as a source for speed of the MHub.

unitCommand.name: Trip Speed from CAN
unitCommand.help: Trip Speed from CAN
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed provided by the CAN Bus connection as the source for speed of the MHub.

unitCommand.name: Trip Distance from Sensor
unitCommand.help: Trip Distance from Sensor
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the speed sensor input as the source for distance (odometer) of the MHub. Note that it is important that the speed calibration is correctly done and is accurate when using the speed sensor as the source of distance.

unitCommand.name: Trip Distance from GPS
unitCommand.help: Trip Distance from GPS
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the information provided by the GPS to calculate the odometer reading of the MHub. As this method uses the GPS, it is very important that the GPS will have coverage throughout the entire trip, as outages of GPS during a trip will cause inaccuracies in the calculation of the odometer.

unitCommand.name: Trip Distance from CAN
unitCommand.help: Trip Distance from CAN
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter will instruct the MHub to use the CAN Bus read distance as the source for distance (odometer) of the MHub.

unitCommand.name: Trip End Event Flush
unitCommand.help: Trip End Event Flush Enable
unitCommand.notes: With the bit set events will be flush at the end of a trip

unitCommand.name: Enable USB
unitCommand.help: Enable the USB subsystem
unitCommand.notes: Setting this parameter to 1 will enable the USB on the MHub. It should always be turned ON.

unitCommand.name: Roaming Operator Selection Enable
unitCommand.help: If enabled registration on selected operator networks when roaming will be treated as home network registration allowing normal event reporting.
unitCommand.notes: In order to provide flexibility in costing of data transmission using both GPRS and SMS over roaming networks, the MHub has the ability to send certain events only when the MHub is in a local network for instance, and not if it is roaming. However, there may be instances where if a MHub roams on a specific "partner" network, that the data costs are similar to those of the local network. So in order to facilitate this, the MHub is able to regard a certain roaming network as actually being a "Home" netwotk. Enabling this parameter will enable the ability of the Mhub to see a roaming netwotk as a Home network, and apply the Home network data transmission rules.

unitCommand.name: Roaming Operator 1
unitCommand.help: Preferred Roaming Operator 1
unitCommand.notes: When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available.

unitCommand.name: Roaming Operator 2
unitCommand.help: Preferred Roaming Operator 2
unitCommand.notes: When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available.

unitCommand.name: Roaming Operator 3
unitCommand.help: Preferred Roaming Operator 3
unitCommand.notes: When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available.

unitCommand.name: Roaming Operator 4
unitCommand.help: Preferred Roaming Operator 4
unitCommand.notes: When a roaming operator provides lower cost data compared to other roaming operators, the operator ID of that roaming operator can be entered into this parameter, and the MHub will then apply its "home" data transmission rules. Also the MHub will always then try to register onto one of these Preferred Roaming Operators if it is available.

unitCommand.help: Aux Port Baudrate
unitCommand.notes: Aux Port Baudrate: 300...9600...115200

unitCommand.name: Beeper 1 Event flag
unitCommand.help: Flag assigned to Beeper 1
unitCommand.notes:
Select one of the following flags. When this flag is active, the beeper will beep according to the corresponding beep code on the Beeper Style parameter: DO NOT USE A VALUE OTHER THAN LISTED BELOW
21 Speeding 22 Excessive RPM 23 Excess Idle 24 Excessive Acceleration 25 Harsh Braking 31 Driver ID Validated 60 Free Wheeling 74 Main Voltage Low

unitCommand.name: Beeper 1 Style
unitCommand.help: Beeping style assigned to Beeper 1
unitCommand.notes: Select Ring tone from 1 to 32 -- or -- If Output 3 is Configured as Buzzer Output 1 = Single 100ms beep 2 = Single 200ms beep 3 = Two x 100ms beeps 100ms apart 4 = Two x 500ms beeps 500ms apart 5 = 100ms beeps 100ms apart 6 = 200ms beeps 200ms apart 7 = Fast(100ms) to slow (400ms) beep 8 = Three x 100ms beeps 100ms apart 9 = Input and Outputs -> Ouput Beeper Configuration Other = OFF (No Beep)

unitCommand.name: Enable TCO Change Event Generation
unitCommand.help: Enable TCO Change Event Generation will generate a FMS Data event everytime TCO variable changes value.
unitCommand.notes: Enable TCO Change Event Generation will generate a FMS Data event everytime TCO variable changes value. FMS Data Event has to enables under Event Configuraion.

unitCommand.name: Enable Custom 3 Event
unitCommand.help: Enable Custom 3 Event triggered by Driver Identification change

unitCommand.name: Reboot Limit
unitCommand.help: The number of On/Off cycles before the Hard reset pin is pulled.
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: No Response Limit
unitCommand.help: The number of times that a request times out before the Modem is rebooted
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Python Script security
unitCommand.help: Sets the read mode of the Python script.
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Python Script Start Mode
unitCommand.help: Python Script Start Mode - refer to AT command docs
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Python Script Enable
unitCommand.help: Enables CMUX states that load and activate the Python script.
unitCommand.notes: !!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!

unitCommand.name: Modem No-Network Restart Delay
unitCommand.help: The amount of time that the unit will wait after rebooting the modem before repeating the process.
unitCommand.notes:
!!! DO NOT MODIFY THIS PARAMETER !!!
None

unitCommand.name: Error Limit
unitCommand.help: Maximum number of accumulated errors before the modem is rebooted
unitCommand.notes: As described in the parameter Reboot Limit, the MHub will issue a reboot command to the modem if it detects a problem with the modem. However if an error is received in response to an instruction to the modem, the MHub will first retry the instruction. This parameter specifies the number of accumulated errors that the MHub can receive from the modem before it will issue a reboot command to the mode.

unitCommand.name: Insurance Daily Event Time
unitCommand.help: Insurance Daily Event Time
unitCommand.notes: The Insurance Daily Event Time parameter is the time in minutes from 00:00 UTC that the Event will be generated and daily Insurance parameters cleared. e.g. 02:30am(UTC) value should be 150 11:00pm(UTC) value should be 1380

unitCommand.name: Enable Sentinel
unitCommand.help: Global Sentinel Enable.
unitCommand.notes: Enable: 111 Disable: Any other value
